bug.author: miguelgfierro
bug.summary: [BUG] Permission denied in Windows test machine
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h3>Description</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code> Traceback (most recent call last): File "C:\Anaconda\lib\site-packages\conda\core\link.py", line 622, in _execute_actions action.execute() File "C:\Anaconda\lib\site-packages\conda\core\path_actions.py", line 373, in execute force=context.force) File "C:\Anaconda\lib\site-packages\conda\gateways\disk\create.py", line 339, in create_link copy(src, dst) File "C:\Anaconda\lib\site-packages\conda\gateways\disk\create.py", line 280, in copy _do_copy(src, dst) File "C:\Anaconda\lib\site-packages\conda\gateways\disk\create.py", line 293, in _do_copy with open(dst, 'wb') as fdst: PermissionError: [Errno 13] Permission denied: 'C:\\Anaconda\\envs\\nightly_reco_gpu\\vcruntime140.dll'
During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:
Traceback (most recent call last): File "C:\Anaconda\lib\site-packages\conda\core\link.py", line 553, in _execute cls._execute_actions(pkg_idx_tracked, axngroup) File "C:\Anaconda\lib\site-packages\conda\core\link.py", line 638, in _execute_actions reverse_excs, conda.CondaMultiError: [Errno 13] Permission denied: 'C:\\Anaconda\\envs\\nightly_reco_gpu\\vcruntime140.dll'
During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:
Traceback (most recent call last): File "C:\Anaconda\lib\site-packages\conda\exceptions.py", line 1003, in __call__ return func(*args, **kwargs) File "C:\Anaconda\lib\site-packages\conda_env\cli\main.py", line 73, in do_call exit_code = getattr(module, func_name)(args, parser) File "C:\Anaconda\lib\site-packages\conda_env\cli\main_create.py", line 101, in execute installer.install(prefix, pkg_specs, args, env) File "C:\Anaconda\lib\site-packages\conda_env\installers\conda.py", line 31, in install unlink_link_transaction.execute() File "C:\Anaconda\lib\site-packages\conda\core\link.py", line 241, in execute self._execute(tuple(concat(interleave(itervalues(self.prefix_action_groups))))) File "C:\Anaconda\lib\site-packages\conda\core\link.py", line 587, in _execute rollback_excs, conda.CondaMultiError: [Errno 13] Permission denied: 'C:\\Anaconda\\envs\\nightly_reco_gpu\\vcruntime140.dll' </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h3>In which platform does it happen?</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h3>How do we replicate the issue?</denchmark-h>
dsvm_nightly_win_gpu -> <denchmark-link:https://dev.azure.com/best-practices/recommenders/_build/results?buildId=16737>https://dev.azure.com/best-practices/recommenders/_build/results?buildId=16737</denchmark-link>
dsvm_nightly_win_cpu -> <denchmark-link:https://dev.azure.com/best-practices/recommenders/_build/results?buildId=16691>https://dev.azure.com/best-practices/recommenders/_build/results?buildId=16691</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h3>Expected behavior (i.e. solution)</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h3>Other Comments</denchmark-h>

comments.comment: updated conda to v=4.7.12 with conda update -n base -c defaults conda I checked that now the gpu env can be installed correctly, now running <denchmark-link:https://dev.azure.com/best-practices/recommenders/_build/results?buildId=16893>nightly cpu</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://dev.azure.com/best-practices/recommenders/_build/results?buildId=16892>nightly gpu</denchmark-link>

that didn't solve the issue: <denchmark-code>Collecting package metadata (repodata.json): ...working... done Solving environment: ...working... Warning: 2 possible package resolutions (only showing differing packages): - defaults::jupyter_console-5.2.0-py36_1, defaults::prompt_toolkit-3.0.0-py_0 - defaults::jupyter_console-6.0.0-py36_0, defaults::prompt_toolkit-2.0.10-py_0done Preparing transaction: ...working... done Verifying transaction: ...working... done Executing transaction: ...working... done ERROR conda.core.link:_execute(700): An error occurred while installing package 'defaults::pywin32-223-py36hfa6e2cd_1'. Rolling back transaction: ...working... done
[Errno 13] Permission denied: 'C:\\Anaconda\\envs\\nightly_reco_base\\Lib\\site-packages\\win32comext\\shell\\shell.pyd' () </denchmark-code>
and <denchmark-code>Collecting package metadata (repodata.json): ...working... done Solving environment: ...working... Warning: 2 possible package resolutions (only showing differing packages): - defaults::jupyter_console-5.2.0-py36_1, defaults::prompt_toolkit-3.0.0-py_0 - defaults::jupyter_console-6.0.0-py36_0, defaults::prompt_toolkit-2.0.10-py_0done initializing UnlinkLinkTransaction with target_prefix: C:\Anaconda\envs\nightly_reco_gpu unlink_precs:
link_precs: defaults::_tflow_select-2.1.0-gpu defaults::blas-1.0-mkl defaults::ca-certificates-2019.10.16-0 defaults::cudatoolkit-9.0-1 defaults::icc_rt-2019.0.0-h0cc432a_1 defaults::intel-openmp-2019.4-245 defaults::msys2-conda-epoch-20160418-1 defaults::pandoc-2.2.3.2-0 defaults::vs2015_runtime-14.16.27012-hf0eaf9b_0
defaults::seaborn-0.9.0-pyh91ea838_1 defaults::tensorflow-1.12.0-gpu_py36ha5f9131_0 defaults::tensorflow-gpu-1.12.0-h0d30ee6_0
Preparing transaction: ...working... done [ClobberError: The package 'defaults::vs2015_runtime-14.16.27012-hf0eaf9b_0' cannot be installed due to a path collision for 'vcruntime140.dll'. This path already exists in the target prefix, and it won't be removed by an uninstall action in this transaction. The path is one that conda Verifying transaction: ...working... done doesn't recognize. It may have been created by another package manager.
, ClobberError: The package 'defaults::pywin32-223-py36hfa6e2cd_1' cannot be installed due to a path collision for 'lib/site-packages/win32/_win32sysloader.pyd'. This path already exists in the target prefix, and it won't be removed by an uninstall action in this transaction. The path is one that conda doesn't recognize. It may have been created by another package manager.
</denchmark-code>

Some temp files could not be erased, I reboot and was able to erase completely the corrupted environment. Now I kicked off the nightly builds again, they will take several hours. Something interesting is that after rebooting the machine I didnÂ´t have to restart the agent.
fixed by rebooting, now we have a new error <denchmark-link:https://github.com/microsoft/recommenders/issues/997>#997</denchmark-link>
